roleset.name: be stuck

example.name: with passive trace
example.text: Temple added that [Sea Containers]-1 is still mired *trace*-1 in legal problems in Bermuda, where the Supreme Court has temporarily barred Sea Containers from buying back its own stock in a case brought by Stena and Tiphook.
example.arg: in Bermuda, where the Supreme Court has temporarily barred Sea Containers from buying back its own stock in a case brought by Stena and Tiphook.

example.name: without passive trace
example.text: But it's just as plausible to argue that if even David Boren can get mired in this sort of mess, the problem goes beyond legal interpretation.

example.name: mud, mired-in as subject
example.text: Well , desperate to escape the economic stagnation that has mired this country for over a decade , they also worry that traditional ways of life would be swept aside by the internet with dotcom jobs replacing life - long employment security , e-commerce endangering business built on personal relationships .

roleset.note: MIRE-V NOTES: This should not even be considered a verb, really, since the activecannot occur: *"John mired Mary in a real mess." (from mire.01-v)
